poem:
Title: "Morning Tinged with Sorrow"

A clouded sky, ochre hued, casts shadows of despair,
Upon this verdant landscape, in genteel countryside and urban lair.
Malnutrition, an unseen spectre, in our midst does creep,
Through clashing worlds of plenty and of lack where poor souls weep.
While we sip from the cup of affluence, let's find a space to share.
In the tillage of human kindness, sow seeds of care.
